verses.verse: Rebuke <WG1969> not <WG3361> an elder <WG4245>, but <WG235> exhort <WG3870> him as <WG5613> a father <WG3962>; the younger men <WG3501> as <WG5613> brethren <WG80>:
the elder women <WG4245> as <WG5613> mothers <WG3384>; the younger <WG3501> as <WG5613> sisters <WG79>, in <WG1722> all <WG3956> purity <WG47>.
Honor <WG5091> widows <WG5503> that are <WG3689> widows <WG5503> indeed <WG3689>.

But <WG1161> if <WG1487> any <WG5100> widow <WG5503> hath <WG2192> children <WG5043> or <WG2228> grandchildren <WG1549>, let them learn <WG3129> first <WG4412> to show piety <WG2151> towards their own family <WG3624>, and <WG2532> to <WG591> requite <WG287> their parents <WG4269>: for <WG1063> this <WG5124> is <WG2076> acceptable <WG587> in the sight <WG1799> of God <WG2316>.

Now <WG1161> she that <WG3588> is <WG3689> a widow <WG5503> indeed <WG3689>, and <WG2532> desolate <WG3443>, hath her hope <WG1679> set on <WG1909> God <WG2316>, and <WG2532> continueth in <WG4357> supplications <WG1162> and <WG2532> prayers <WG4335> night <WG3571> and <WG2532> day <WG2250>.
But <WG1161> she that <WG3588> giveth herself to pleasure <WG4684> is dead <WG2348> while she liveth <WG2198>.
<WG2532> These things <WG5023> also command <WG3853>, that <WG2443> they may be <WG5600> without reproach <WG423>.

But <WG1161> if <WG1487> any <WG5100> provideth <WG4306> not <WG3756> for <WG4306> his own <WG2398>, and <WG2532> specially <WG3122> his own household <WG3609>, he hath denied <WG720> the faith <WG4102>, and <WG2532> is <WG2076> worse <WG5501> than an unbeliever <WG571>.
Let <WG2639> none <WG3361> be enrolled <WG2639> as a widow <WG5503> under <WG1640> threescore <WG1835> years old <WG2094>, having been <WG1096> the wife <WG1135> of one <WG1520> man <WG435>,

well reported of <WG3140> for <WG1722> good <WG2570> works <WG2041>; if <WG1487> she hath brought up children <WG5044>, if <WG1487> she hath used hospitality to strangers <WG3580>, if <WG1487> she hath washed <WG3538> the saints <WG40>' feet <WG4228>, if <WG1487> she hath relieved <WG1884> the afflicted <WG2346>, if <WG1487> she hath diligently followed <WG1872> every <WG3956> good <WG18> work <WG2041>.
But <WG1161> younger <WG3501> widows <WG5503> refuse <WG3868>: for <WG1063> when <WG3752> they have waxed wanton against <WG2691> Christ <WG5547>, they desire <WG2309> to marry <WG1060>;
having <WG2192> condemnation <WG2917>, because <WG3754> they have rejected <WG114> their <WG3588> first <WG4413> pledge <WG4102>.

And <WG1161> withal <WG260> they learn <WG3129> also to be idle <WG692>, going about <WG4022> from house to house <WG3614>; and <WG1161> not <WG3756> only <WG3440> idle <WG692>, but <WG235> tattlers <WG5397> also <WG2532> and <WG2532> busybodies <WG4021>, speaking <WG2980> things which <WG3588> they ought <WG1163> not <WG3361>.

I desire <WG1014> therefore <WG3767> that <WG1060> the younger widows <WG3501> marry <WG1060>, bear children <WG5041>, rule the household <WG3616>, give <WG1325> no <WG3367> occasion <WG874> to the adversary <WG480> for reviling <WG3059>:
for <WG1063> already <WG2235> some <WG5100> are <WG1624> turned aside <WG1624> after <WG3694> Satan <WG4567>.

If <WG1487> any5100, Nahum3, 2228 woman <WG4103> that believeth <WG4103> hath <WG2192> widows <WG5503>, let her relieve <WG1884> them <WG846>, and <WG2532> let <WG916> not <WG3361> the church <WG1577> be burdened <WG916>; that <WG2443> it may relieve <WG1884> them that <WG3588> are <WG3689> widows <WG5503> indeed <WG3689>.

Let <WG515> the elders <WG4245> that rule <WG4291> well <WG2573> be counted worthy <WG515> of double <WG1362> honor <WG5092>, especially <WG3122> those who labor <WG2872> in <WG1722> the word <WG3056> and <WG2532> in teaching <WG1319>.

For <WG1063> the scripture <WG1124> saith <WG3004>, Thou shalt <WG5392> not <WG3756> muzzle <WG5392> the ox <WG1016> when he treadeth out the corn <WG248>. And <WG2532>, The laborer <WG2040> is worthy <WG514> of his <WG846> hire <WG3408>.
Against <WG2596> an elder <WG4245> receive <WG3858> not <WG3361> an accusation <WG2724>, except <WG1622> at <WG1909> the mouth of two <WG1417> or <WG2228> three <WG5140> witnesses <WG3144>.
Them that sin <WG264> reprove <WG1651> in the sight <WG1799> of all <WG3956>, that <WG2443> the rest <WG3062> also <WG2532> may <WG2192> be in fear <WG5401>.

I charge <WG1263> thee in the sight <WG1799> of God <WG2316>, and2532, 2962 Christ <WG5547> Jesus <WG2424>, and <WG2532> the elect <WG1588> angels <WG32>, that <WG2443> thou observe <WG5442> these things <WG5023> without <WG5565> prejudice <WG4299>, doing <WG4160> nothing <WG3367> by <WG2596> partiality <WG4346>.
Lay <WG2007> hands <WG5495> hastily <WG5030> on <WG2007> no man <WG3367>, neither <WG3366> be partaker of <WG2841> other men <WG245>'s sins <WG266>: keep <WG5083> thyself <WG4572> pure <WG53>.

Be no longer <WG3371> a drinker <WG5202> of water <WG5202>, but <WG235> use <WG5530> a little <WG3641> wine <WG3631> for <WG1223> thy <WG4675> stomach <WG4751>'s sake <WG1223> and <WG2532> thine <WG4675> often <WG4437> infirmities <WG769>.
Some <WG5100> men <WG444>'s sins <WG266> are <WG1526> evident <WG4271>, going before <WG4254> unto <WG1519> judgment <WG2920>; and <WG1161> some <WG5100> men also they follow after <WG1872>.

In like <WG5615> manner also <WG2532> there are <WG2076> good <WG2570> works <WG2041> that are <WG2192> evident <WG4271>; and <WG2532> such as are <WG2192> otherwise <WG247> cannot <WG3756> be hid <WG2928>.
